revised_title: Critique of Binary System Statistics and Superstructure
tldr: This article critiques the statistical methods used in studying binary systems, particularly the work of K. Fuchs. It highlights errors in the calculations and cautions against accepting the quantitative conclusions. The author also discusses the critical temperature and the concept of superstructure, explaining that the equations used may not accurately represent the phenomena. The article compares the binary system to the Ising model of ferromagnetism and mentions the need for more rigorous testing and evidence.
